eu_initiatives:
We have been advocating for:  
1.    Trinidad and Tobago's compliance with the OECD Global Forum on Transparency and Exchange of Information for Tax Purposes and the de- listing of Trinidad and Tobago from the EU's list of non-cooperative jurisdictions for tax purposes; 2018 
2.    Ratification and full implementation of the CARIFORUM-EU Economic Partnership Agreement; this is on going. 
3.    Ratification of the Paris Climate Change Agreement.  We wrote to the Ministry of Planning for updates then partnered with 5 other organisations to write to Cabinet Ministers.  The Agreement was ratified a few months after our letters in 2018 and now we continue to advocate for the legislative changes which would encourage renewable energy, waste management and recycling and other clean technologies across other industries including maritime industry and cities.

relevant_communication:
Letter to the Ministry of Finance and Economy, March 2018 Re:     Non-Compliant rating of Trinidad and Tobago in the OECD Global Forum on Transparency and Exchange of Information for Tax Purposes 
Letter to the Ministry of Finance and Economy, June 2018 Re:     Follow up on: Non-Compliance rating of Trinidad and Tobago in the OECD Global Forum on Transparency and Exchange of Information for Tax Purposes and listing of Trinidad and Tobago on the EU non-cooperative jurisdictions for tax purposes. 
Special Report: THE GLOBAL FORUM ON TRANSPARENCY AND EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION FOR TAX PURPOSES – REQUIREMENTS FOR MAKING TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO COMPLIANT AND BEING REMOVED FROM THE EU BLACKLIST 
Update on the Legislative Process re THE GLOBAL FORUM ON TRANSPARENCY AND EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION FOR TAX PURPOSES 
Letter to the Ministry of Trade and Industry re Status of the CARIFORUM – EU Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) 
May 2017, EurochamTT was invited to participate in the Joint EU-CARICOM Parliamentary Meeting held in Trinidad and Tobago and had the opportunity to raise the fact the EPA was not fully implemented in Trinidad and Tobago and its implementation could produce benefits in terms of tariff reductions not just for European exports but also for local industry. 
September 2017, EUROCHAMTT in partnership with the EU Delegation, hosted a joint workshop to present recommendations on actions needed: ‘A Sustainable Energy Implementation Plan 2021/2030 for Trinidad and Tobago,’ presented by I.Stefanou, Senior Expert in Renewable Energy under EU Technical Assistance for Sustainable Energy for All Initiative (SE4All). 
Following the above seminar, EUROCHAMTT published a press release, Strong case for Private Sector Led Growth in Developing Renewable Energy.
